filmography.title: The Godfather
filmography.role_description: The volatile, hot-tempered eldest son of the Corleone crime family who serves as underboss and temporarily takes command, leading to tragic consequences.
filmography.plot: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor; Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Movies (#2)

filmography.title: Misery
filmography.role_description: A famous romance novelist who is rescued from a car crash by his "number one fan," only to find himself held captive and forced to write a new book.
filmography.plot: After a famous author is rescued from a car crash by a fan of his novels, he comes to realize that the care he is receiving is only the beginning of a nightmare of captivity and abuse.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nominated – Best Actor; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Thrills (#12)

filmography.title: Thief
filmography.role_description: A highly professional safecracker who specializes in high-stakes diamond heists and tries to balance his criminal life with a desire for a normal family.
filmography.plot: An expert safe cracker grows closer to his dream of leading a normal life when he agrees to do a job for the mafia, who have other plans for him.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nominated – Palme d'Or

filmography.title: Brian's Song
filmography.role_description: Based on the true story of the Chicago Bears running back who develops a close interracial friendship with Gale Sayers before being stricken with terminal cancer.
filmography.plot: Based on the real-life relationship between teammates Brian Piccolo and Gale Sayers and the bond established when Piccolo discovers that he is dying.
filmography.awards: Emmy: Nominated – Outstanding Single Performance by an Actor in a Leading Role

filmography.title: Elf
filmography.role_description: A cynical, workaholic children's book publisher who discovers he has an adult son who was raised by elves at the North Pole.
filmography.plot: Raised as an oversized elf, Buddy travels from the North Pole to New York City to meet his biological father, Walter Hobbs, who doesn't know he exists and is in desperate need of some Christmas spirit.

filmography.title: Rollerball
filmography.role_description: The superstar athlete of a violent futuristic sport who becomes a threat to the corporate state because of his individual popularity.
filmography.plot: In a corporate-controlled future, an ultra-violent sport known as Rollerball represents the world, and one of its powerful athletes is out to defy those who want him out of the game.

filmography.title: The Gambler
filmography.role_description: A literature professor with a severe gambling addiction who spirals into debt and danger, driven by a self-destructive need to lose.
filmography.plot: A literature professor with a gambling vice gets in over his head with the mob and his family.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor – Drama

filmography.title: El Dorado
filmography.role_description: A young, knife-throwing gambler who teams up with a gunfighter and a drunken sheriff to defend a rancher family.
filmography.plot: Cole Thornton, a gunfighter for hire, joins forces with an old friend, Sheriff J.P. Harrah, to help a rancher and his family fight a rival rancher trying to steal their water.

filmography.title: A Bridge Too Far
filmography.role_description: A tough, loyal American sergeant who threatens a surgeon at gunpoint to ensure his critically wounded captain receives life-saving treatment.
filmography.plot: Operation Market Garden, September 1944: The Allies attempt to capture several strategically important bridges in the Netherlands in the hope of breaking the German lines.

filmography.title: Funny Lady
filmography.role_description: The showman and producer who becomes the third husband of Fanny Brice, engaging in a fiery and competitive relationship with the star.
filmography.plot: The story of Fanny Brice's life after her marriage to Nick Arnstein ends, focusing on her relationship with songwriter and impresario Billy Rose.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor – Comedy or Musical

filmography.title: Cinderella Liberty
filmography.role_description: A lonely sailor stuck in bureaucratic limbo who falls in love with a prostitute and becomes a father figure to her son.
filmography.plot: A sailor falls in love with a hooker and becomes a surrogate father figure for her son while stuck in Seattle on extended liberty.

filmography.title: Alien Nation
filmography.role_description: A hard-boiled police detective who is forced to partner with an alien "Newcomer" to solve a series of crimes in a racially integrated Los Angeles.
filmography.plot: A few years from now, Earth will have the first contact with an alien civilization. These aliens, known as Newcomers, slowly begin to be integrated into human society after years of quarantine.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nominated – Best Science Fiction Film

filmography.title: The Rain People
filmography.role_description: A brain-damaged former college football player who is picked up by a woman fleeing her marriage and forms a fragile bond with her.
filmography.plot: A housewife, discovering she is pregnant, runs away from home and picks up a hitchhiker who is a former football player with brain damage.
filmography.awards: San Sebastian International Film Festival: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Bottle Rocket
filmography.role_description: A charismatic, eccentric local crime boss who becomes a mentor to a group of inept amateur thieves.
filmography.plot: Three friends plan to pull off a simple robbery and go on the run.

filmography.title: Honeymoon in Vegas
filmography.role_description: A wealthy professional gambler and mobster who tricks a man into debt to steal his fiancée for a weekend.
filmography.plot: A private eye loses his girlfriend in a poker game to a wealthy gambler who arranges to take her to Hawaii for the weekend.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Motion Picture – Comedy or Musical

filmography.title: Gardens of Stone
filmography.role_description: A veteran sergeant assigned to the Old Guard at Arlington National Cemetery who opposes the Vietnam War but dutifully buries its dead.
filmography.plot: A sergeant in the US Army's ceremonial unit wants to save the life of a young soldier by getting him transferred away from combat duty in Vietnam.

filmography.title: The Way of the Gun
filmography.role_description: A cool, experienced "bagman" and enforcer who is brought in to negotiate a kidnapping situation involving amateur criminals.
filmography.plot: Two criminal drifters kidnap a pregnant surrogate mother and hold her for ransom, but the bagman sent to deliver the money has his own agenda.

filmography.title: Dogville
filmography.role_description: A powerful gangster and the father of the protagonist, Grace, representing a cynical, Old Testament view of justice.
filmography.plot: A woman on the run from the mob is reluctantly accepted in a small Colorado town, but the price she must pay for their protection becomes unbearable.

filmography.title: The Yards
filmography.role_description: A corrupt businessman who runs the commuter rail yards in Queens and draws his nephew into a world of industrial sabotage and murder.
filmography.plot: In the rail yards of Queens, contractors repair and rebuild the city's subway cars. It is a place where corruption is a way of life.

filmography.title: Mickey Blue Eyes
filmography.role_description: A mobster who tries to help his future son-in-law, a British auctioneer, navigate the criminal underworld with hilarious results.
filmography.plot: An English auctioneer proposes to the daughter of a mafia kingpin, only to find himself in over his head.

filmography.title: Eraser
filmography.role_description: A corrupt U.S. Marshal and former mentor to the protagonist who is revealed to be the mole inside the Witness Protection Program.
filmography.plot: A Witness Protection specialist becomes suspicious of his co-workers when dealing with a case involving high-tech weapons.

filmography.title: Flesh and Bone
filmography.role_description: A sinister, abusive father and career criminal who returns to torment his estranged son decades after a brutal family murder.
filmography.plot: A man who witnessed a brutal murder as a child falls in love with a woman who is connected to his dark past.

filmography.title: Comes a Horseman
filmography.role_description: A WWII veteran trying to start a small ranch who teams up with a stubborn woman to fight off a wealthy land baron.
filmography.plot: Two ranchers form an uneasy alliance to save their land from a ruthless cattle baron and oil interests.

filmography.title: Chapter Two
filmography.role_description: A writer mourning his late wife who rushes into a new marriage with an actress, struggling to reconcile his grief with his new love.
filmography.plot: A recently widowed writer starts a new romance with an actress, but memories of his first wife threaten their happiness.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Motion Picture – Comedy or Musical

filmography.title: Freebie and the Bean
filmography.role_description: A reckless, rule-breaking San Francisco cop who, along with his partner, causes chaos while trying to bring down a local racketeer.
filmography.plot: Two bumbling but effective San Francisco police detectives wreak havoc on the city while trying to bring down a numbers racket boss.

filmography.title: Slither
filmography.role_description: An ex-convict who gets caught up in a road trip to find a stash of embezzled money after his friend is murdered.
filmography.plot: An ex-con tries to find a fortune in stolen cash, but he's not the only one looking for it.

filmography.title: The Killer Elite
filmography.role_description: A private security agent who is crippled by his partner's betrayal and undergoes grueling rehabilitation to seek revenge.
filmography.plot: A CIA agent is betrayed by his partner and left for dead, but he survives and trains in martial arts to take revenge.

filmography.title: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
filmography.role_description: The technophobic, sardine-loving father of the protagonist Flint, who struggles to understand his son's inventions.
filmography.plot: A local scientist is often regarded as a failure until he invents a machine that can make food fall from the sky. But little does he know, that things are about to take a turn for the worst.
